Reviews.Title: “Heed all Warnings!”
Reviews.Author: juli n
Reviews.Content: Despite the warnings from previous guests, I gave the hotel the benefit of the doubt and booked a room. Big mistake! The warning signs from previous guests include, "the whole room stinks." CHECK. It's a pet friendly hotel so that annoying smell?? Hellooo poodle! Regarding the bathtub, "it had deep ingrained dirt in the bath." CHECK. We had to shower with sandals to protect our feet! As to the towels, not only were they "old and crusty," CHECK, but on the second day we received one with blood stains! Exibit A from a previous incident? What about the "Roaches" you ask? Oh yeah, you guessed it, CHECK! So word to the wise, dismiss all doubts and heed all warnings. The close proximity to the parks, and low rates are not worth the scare.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the long drive to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Ewokies
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel would be less than ideal when I booked it for a week. We just needed a place to sleep and shower since we were gone about 14-16 hours each day. This hotel is about 5 miles from Disney, which we thought wouldn't be a big deal, but my goodness that drive is a long 5 miles! There's a lot of CLOSER 1 star hotels that advertise the same low price we got our week booked for. I was unable to find them ONLINE though, when doing my research before booking this place. The room was...acceptable since it filled our main needs. We couldn't change rooms since they were completely booked and we pre-paid for our week there. The resort fee was cheap, but not even worth it since none of the extra stuff really worked. The bed was surprisingly comfortable. The AC worked and made the room nice and cold on a hot, sunny day. The bathroom's toilet and tub worked, but looked kind of gross as well. It had a bad odor. There was mold forming on the ceiling above one of the beds. The safe didn't work. So that was pointless. The fridge door kept opening, so all of our food got spoiled. I thought it was an error on my part for not paying attention when I shut the fridge's door...but then by the 3rd or 4th day I finally remembered to make sure it's SHUT before we left for 16 hours...yeah came back and the door was open again. Had to throw everything out since most of it was dairy. The ice machine was BROKEN. We managed to get about 10 ice cubes the first morning, but after that nothing ever came out. So we had to buy our own ice at a nearby store ($2 a bag) for the cooler box. I left my husband in charge of the ice, I went to inspect it after a few days and saw that someone had been throwing trash and questionable things in the drain of the ice machine, so that looked VERY gross. We didn't get to use the swimming pool. The one night we considered it, a couple looked like they were getting a little too close for the public eye, so we opted out of that. So in the end, yes we got what we mainly wanted, a place to sleep and shower...but in the end I wish we could of afforded something better...and CLOSER. WAY CLOSER. It's annoying that there's so many other cheap hotels that are more near Disney, but not easy to find online!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: Nicky W
Reviews.Content: Not a joyful experience. Our room had an ant infestation. The bathroom was so small and so old! It had deep ingrained dirt in the bath - horrible. Although there were plenty of towels they were old and crusty. We were assured that there was wi-fi but when we arrived they had suffered a power surge and said they wouldn't be able to rectify this for at least 5 days. Needless to say we moved to another hotel as soon as we could.

Reviews.Title: “!!!!!!!!!!!Warning sleep in car before sleeping here!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christianj83
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE!!! The whole room stinks. The sheets, towels, floors, and staff. We slept with no ac for two nights and when we complained they said there was nothing they could do because they were booked. My wife finally flipped out on the third night with no ac and the manager got in our faces when we complained in front of other customers. Long story short we had to get in our car and check out at two in the morning with a sleeping 4 year old. We will NEVER stay at a Howard Johnson again!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: RONDA M
Reviews.Content: After a long day at Disney. We checked into one of the tree house rooms. I walked into the bathroom to find dried urine on the toilet seat. One of the kids beds looked like the bed sheets had not been changed. I went to call the front desk and the phone did not work. There was orange soda spilled on the night stand and not cleaned up. I went to the front desk and advised the person there and they seemed like it was not a big deal about 15 min later I had a couple knock on the door to clean. The guy was carrying the clean sheets with a broom touching the sheets. They cleaned the toilet and changed the sheet and left. No apology or anything. The next morning we were getting ready to check out and doing the normal sweep of the room to see if we had all of our belongings. We went to check under the bed to find a cup (that had the orange soda in it that was spilled on the night stand), a dirty sock and someone’s deodorant. The counter tops looked like they had not been cleaned the tub was dirty. There was stuff all over the walls that has not been wiped off. The smoke detector was hanging off the wall in the kid’s top bunk and the light switch to turn the lights on/off by the bunks was not tight against the wall. The microwave did not work and there was no remote to the TV. Needless to say I feel like calling the health department because the place was so disgusting. I will never stay at another Howard Johnson hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Things Change”
Reviews.Author: MikeTFox
Reviews.Content: Ok, well since my last review, I have stayed again at The Howard Johnson Enchanted Land, and sadly this time, things were very different!. Not going to write a long review, but we had book for a 14 night stay, and had to check out after only 3 nights. Room was smelly, ants all around the bathroom area, hairdryer not working, pool not heated and then the final strew, the internet went off, and was not going to be back on for 5 days. Manager agreed to refund our remaining days but not for the nights already stayed, I had planned to go with a group of 6 friends in January for 5 weeks, but decided against it.

Reviews.Title: “Another Old Motel with a Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: markbyrn24
Reviews.Content: There's nothing more infuriating than paying a resort fee for an old & poorly maintained motel that's little more than a glorified Motel-6. Fortunately, the fee is only $2.50 and there was free Internet in the room. The best thing I can say in staying at this absurdly named Enchanted Land motel was the enchanted bargain price that I got through a discount service (about half the normal rate), and it helped me deal with a non-working heater, the old bed linen with torn quilt, and the maids that were banging at my door to make sure I left by 11:00 AM. The room does include a fridge and microwave although I didn't check to see if they worked. While the motel has certainly seen better days, if you can get a room at a bargain price and you can deal with the inevitable maintenance issues and run-down appearance, it might be worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “We had unexpected guests in our room.”
Reviews.Author: Norra T
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights here while we were going to Disney World. I wish I just paid more for a better hotel. Our first night wasn't bad. It was when we woke up getting ready for a day at Disney we found a roach on our nightstand. This was not a small roach. We killed the roach and took a picture in my blackberry phone which I no longer have unfortunately. I would've posted the image. Management was nice enough to refund our money but not the resort fee (The place is not a resort!) The manager advised they just sprayed for bugs in the last couple of days which could've caused the roach to come out. So worked up about the roach I forgot to mention to the manager our tub was leaking. They tried to cover the bottom of the tub with a plastic. I could never figure out why there was a puddle of water next to the tub after someone showered. We immediately checked out and stayed at a nicer location closer to Disney. I will never stay at another Howard Johnson.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Visited on our Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Natillac
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel on a whim. We were exhausted and looking for a good nights sleep before our early flight in the morning. The rooms were disgusting. Floors had not been vacuumed, the bedding was so dirty (hair & what looked to be blood) and there were bugs on the bathroom floor. After calling room service to bring us new bed sheets, we were kept up with loud noises. There is a reason it is cheap - it’s poor! I do not recommend this hotel to anyone - you're better off sleeping in your car!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!”
Reviews.Author: kdubb8
Reviews.Content: I am currently stuck outside my hotel hotel room waiting for the people up front to come unlock my door. First they charged us twice because they "hadn't recieved our reservation" but then 20 minutes later when we were unpacking they call and say they got our reservation but for some reason charged us a $2.50 for their mistake. Now they say our doors battery is dead or something so no cards will work on it, so whenever we want to leave our room we either leave it cracked open or go up front and wait 15 minutes for them to come down and see we're not lieing and the keys won't work. All in all, terrible place. To add to the matter only one person speaks english it seems like and our toilet leaks water. Maybe we just got a bad room but i know i will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!!Terrible Hotel!!Stinks!Dirty! Terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: JamesW W
Reviews.Content: We were told so many lies while we were there.Before we came there we were told... A free shuttle service to disney. Not true. There was a foul dirty odor in our room so bad we had to sleep with the sheets over our faces at night while we slept.They did not get rid of it. Hot tub broke. The carpet was nasty to walk on, had to keep my shoes on while in our room. No free breakfast. They charged an extra $5.50 each day we stayed...they said it was for incidentals.. what incidentals??

Reviews.Title: “There's a reason this motel is so cheap, it's horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Disney_visit
Reviews.Content: Our room (148) smelled wet and musty, there was old chewing gum on the lamp, the safe didn't work, the walls were cracked, peeling and sort of repaired with joint compound but left unpainted. There was a hair ball in the rib that wasn't ours. Overall this place was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “12/16/11 HoJo - Enchanted Land Hotel????? NOT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: This place is NASTY!! The photos are 25-30 years old on this site....Right after we checked in to the room we showed the man who came to our room, the dried up bug smashed on the wall and the spotted stained OLD sheets, he LAUGHED & smiled at us ....not understanding a word we were saying, I called the front desk; the lady at the front desk said "it's probably a stain, they have been washed!!" (Really? Probably?!! I don't want to sleep on someone’s stains? Toss them out??!!!! And the spattered bugs & spattered brown marks on the bathroom walls??!! ) I have more pictures!!! I can E-mail ANY ONE!! The Spider Egg sacks were VERY HAPPY LIVING ON THE INSIDE OF ALL THE DOOR JAMS OF OUR ROOM!!(See photos) When walking across the floor there was 4-5 different areas that had Quarter size Items like "rocks & bottle caps" UNDER THE CARPET!!! NICE!!! REALLY GREAT when it came to waking up and or just stepping on them EVERY TIME you walked across the room!! Even with sandals on. Then so CALLED internet cuts off every 3-7 minutes and you call the front desk and the lady would say "let me reset the router"…THIS HAPPENED BOTH NIGHTS!!! (ALL NIGHT) There was a water break in a line there and I went to get water from one of the 4 vending machines. I was willing to pay for myself...(1 was not even plugged in) THE OTHER 3 had nothing in them, every time I picked an Item it said "make another selection" the cans in the window of this machine had 3 inches of dust on each can’s top. (That worried me to start with)...The day time manager said "oh, maybe he come next week, but you go to Publix down the road now, OK? (All in bad English foreign accent) and he walks off!!!! I called the front desk the 1st night and asked about the cable channels (18-20 in all) 3 of them the same, 4 with no sound, and asked which on was HBO?? She said "I’ll have to check and see & call you back".....I never got a call BACK that night!!! 2nd night after a LONG day of out & about running the roads, I called the front desk again and asked which one was HBO?? (About 8 pm) They guy said he'd have to look also and get back to me, later at 10:30 pm I call again and an American sounding woman said "OH 38 & 39 for HBO and 40 for Showtime!" I replied “Channel 39 has a loud buzzing coming from it with no show audio and 40 is a little blue square bouncing around the screen with the logo on it for Direct TV??" She said "yes those!!" and then "OK?" and hung up!!! When checking out Sunday morning. 2 other guest were at the counter also trying to get issues settled, One man had been totally without water for 2 days, a lady had very bad complaints about the smell of her room!!! (Pet odors she said) All the people at the front desk were saying were “A huh…OK?” and nothing more…..Not even addressing them…It felt like WE WERE the ones IN A 3RD WORLD COUNTRY in a CHEAP ROTTEN HOTEL, NASTY!! And I to think used my free rewards points for one of these “night’s” stay?? What a waste of 6,000 points!!!!We visit Hotels in Orlando 2-3 times per year…Howard Johnson should not be associated with this hotel!!!! Or even Wyndham Rewards!!

Reviews.Title: “Contaminated Spa”
Reviews.Author: geomyl
Reviews.Content: I should have checked Trip Advisor before I checked into this hotel. The pool was heated and the spa was inviting until I saw the poop in the water, Yuck!!!!Otherwise, the room was clean and large but again no internet access. Manager wasn't very helpful regarding the internet as he showed me that his wireless worked so should mine. didn't work in the lobby either. I thought that when I checked out and went home that I would have problems but alas the moment I turned on my computer I had internet access..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MikeTFox
Reviews.Content: I visit Orlando a few times a year, and by chance ended up staying at Enchanted Land, to which I was pleasantly surprised, this hotel isn´t claiming to be a 5 star, but you can´t beat it for value for money. I have stayed there 5 times now in the past 3 years, the rooms are clean, pool is heated, the manager, Sanjay and staff are very friendly and helpful, plus the free internet access is a very nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room...Huge Value...Low Cost!”
Reviews.Author: BillW73
Reviews.Content: I had no problems with one of the lowest cost hotels in Kissimmee. Everything was clean and well service each morning over the eight nights spent at the HJ Enchanted Land (Room 228). The front desk was professional and helpful. This is not the Hilton and my room did show some carpet wear, but room cost was below $30/night including the $2.50/nt. resort fee. The internet worked well. There was a refrigerator and microwave in my room but I'm not sure if these are extra cost items but I was not not charged extra. Please note...there is NO hotel shuttle to Disney, but the Lynx bus stop is just beyond the lobby door. There is a Publix (super market) within walking distance as well as several chain resturants very close by. I would have no problem staying at the HJ Enchanted Land again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jennyjr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is out dated but for the price you cant go wrong. Room was clean and staff was friendly. The pool and pool area was kind of small but it was at least clean. We stayed in the Crayola room (1 double bed and a day bed. Day bed has a twin bed under it) w/ activity table. It was nice because we had 2 TV and the kids had a small activity table to place their stuff. But with the activity table in the room it made the room feel small and scrammed. Room had a fridge and microwave which was a plus. This was my 3 time staying here and I never had a problem. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: MNJV_4
Reviews.Content: I am astonished that some people can even say they had a great experience at this hotel. Where to I begin. The place was disgusting!! I am not a "snob" by any means but in all honesty it was just gross. I refused to let my kids bath in the bathtub that was flithy. The rooms looked like they had barely been vacumed. To the point I didnt even want to take my shoes off. I have been in the customer service field for many years so I understand both sides of the coin however, their staff were horrible. Our a/c broke in the middle of the night. I called and she sounded like I woke her up and she was ticked to begin with but she said ok I'll get in looked after in the morning. I said excuse me its plus 90 out and you want me to stay in this room with no a/c I dont think so. So she said well it is the middle of the night and im just learning of this now ! UMMM well it JUST BROKE !! She said well what do you want me to do about it ....I have no other rooms. I said you can start by giving me my money back. So she said just hold on. Put me on hold for 10 mins and then comes back and I guess by an act of God another room came available in 10 mins. If we werent staying for only one night we would have changed hotels. We were tired and just needed some sleep. Wrong decission. I have severe allergies to animals. We were not informed that this a pet friendly place (we learned this by seeing a lot of animals in other rooms). Which would be fine if they properly cleaned the rooms properly or informed customers of this policy. I am now severly sick. I could honestly go on and on about this place but , I wont. I only stayed there for one day...I couldnt imagne if we had been there for longer.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Caracal_11
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I stayed at Enchanted Land while we did the whole "Disney/Bush" thing. WE LOVED IT! The front desk staff were very accomodating in switching our rooms from upstairs to downstairs, as I wasn't physically able to negotiate the stairs on a daily basis. They even upgraded our room for us! I confess, I paid an embarassing low rate for this hotel and wasn't expecting much... WOW! We got more than I ever anticipated! Bad points: They did say breakfast would be free - it was a poor continental breakfast that was free & the one they were charging for didn't look much better. That's the only bad point! The pool and hot tub were clean with a lovely mural wall. Overall: We were enchanted with Enchanted Land and cannot wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “I worried about nothing!”
Reviews.Author: LoveFlorida72
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here I was really worried about staying at this hotel, seven of us stayed here for a total of 14 nights in two seperate rooms & didnt have one problem, the maid service was great..beds made everyday, clean towels/sheets, pleasant staff at the reception desk, we had no fridge in our room when we arrived I asked reception & we had one by the time we came back from the park, this place is ideal if you want somewhere basic close to the parks just to sleep, on a few occasions when we came back earlyish from the parks the children went in the swimming pool/jacuzzi...which were both great too. Free internet as well in the lobby that was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: bunnybaby99510
Reviews.Content: So, after booking this hotel and then reading the reviews(backwards I know) I was nervous. I was pleasently surprised! The outside of the hotel is not very visually appealing and most of the plants outside are fake but truthfully dont let that deter you. The room was cleaner than expected after the reviews I saw. Check in was easy fast and the staff were helpful. We had many requests and all of them were fulfilled (we requested a ground room, close to the pool, extra pillows) The pool is nice although it isnt heated. I wouldnt suggest you go anywhere near the jacuzzi because that thing is so hot you may come out with burns. They do have a business center open 24 hours but it only has one computer(still kinda nice). The fitness center only had 2 machines- a treadmill and a bicycle machine. We rented a treehouse room and we have four kids(4,2,2,1). Although the room was smaller than expected there was still ample space for all of us. The kids LOVED this room, there was even a t.v. inside the bottom of the treehouse! The room was clean and the hotel is also close to very many food establishments. Everything from olive garden to cicis pizza there is a walmart like a few miles away. There is a microwave, fridge, coffee maker,safe, hair dryer, desk and free wifi. The one thing that annoyed me is that housekeeping left envelopes in the rooms asking for tips. Otherwise they kept everything clean and tidy. The hotel was quiet and there were no issues while we stayed there,

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Place: Bathroom Ceiling Drenched Me With Water While On Toilet”
Reviews.Author: vyannuzzi
Reviews.Content: There is nothing enchanting about this place. My wife and I stayed there Feb 21-25. We planned to split time netween the Orlando attractions and the Kennedy Space Center/see the shuttle take off. On our 2nd day I became very sick with food poisoning I think I got from oysters at a restaurant. Upon returning to our room I went straight to bed hoping to feel better the next morning. At 5:00 am I made my 7th or 8th trip to the bathroom in 24 hours to expunge the illness (nice way to put it). Approx 2 minutes after sitting down ...the ceiling above me drenched me with cold water in a steady stream directly on my head and back and down my body . I was unable to leave the bathroom for 7-10 more minutes due to the food poisoning. I got completely drenched by water I have no idea what it contained. After calling the front desk, the only person on duty (who was not a manager) came to the room. It was 6:00 am before we got to the new room and 7:30 am before we fell back asleep (the a/c had not been running and it was 80 degrees in the room). As a result, in addition to the totally disgusting experience our time schedule was totally disrupted. We had planned to go to Disney's Animal Kingdom that day but we ended up sleeping til 11:00 am. Then we had to retrieve all our belongings (3 unpacked suitcases and a fridge full of water) from the old room and take it to the new room. Not fun. Over the next 3 days I asked 3 times to speak with a manager and was never given a name , phone number or option to do so. The only worker I ever saw was a young 20 something man named Mr. Patel. On the 4th day we planned to see the Space Shuttle take off in Titusville. So I went to the office to use the "business center".....1 old and dirty computer that did not work. Three times it said it was "logging off" and Mr. Patel was unable to fix it. 20 more minutes of my time wasted. The hotel was dirty, there was no manager available and it was a horrible experience. I would caution anyone to NEVER STAY HERE. After the trip I spent hours trying to contact this hotel and Howard Johnson's national customer service ad in the end all they were willing to do wa give me 1 night free in the future at this hotel. I live in Maryland, not Orlando. I have no idea when I will be back in Orlando. And it's a $25 hotel. Does this seem like adequate compensation for getting drenched water containing who knows what? Beware of this place.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: sofiafuruya
Reviews.Content: The photos do not match with the real room. I saw a cockroach near the table of the food at the breakfast room. This hotel is awful and disgusting. I choose this hotel, because for twice I have stayed in a Howard Johnson at Buenos Aires and I thought all Howard Johnson was good, but not this one at Kissimmee!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: bebe000
Reviews.Content: for a very inexpensive rate we had a room near the pool and bbq area, it was clean and we liked the breakfast buffet nothing fancy but good to start the day, close to disney and the staff were very kind. We were treated well with greetings as we passed front desk each day a gent named jigar was especially nice from front desk as well as a sweet little gal named rupa that we saw mostly in the dining area. overall you got a decent place to sleep and stay for a small price.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Bonkers4Disney
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find hair in all three beds. The banister of the tree house room was so gross I took I wet facecloth and BLACK came off on to it when I wiped it down. I was appalled they would let anyone sleep here. After promptly leaving and told we would get our money back because we refused to stay in a room with DIRTY SHEETS, I still a week later do not have a refund and I am getting the run around. Watch out, DON"T stay here! We live an hour away from Disney, and stay two times a month as a get away with the kids. This is the worst hotel I have EVER stayed in. GROSS!

Reviews.Title: “This place is awlful!!!!! Keep looking elsewhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: MThompson0976
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the pictures online, come to find out they are VERY deceiving......This was the first trip where I took my children to stay at a hotel and it is very sad that they didn't even want to stay here. This place is an alwful place to stay...we had a large roach crawling on the table & spiders (in my bed) in the room. The whole place is dirty and way out of date!!! The soda machines were not even plugged in throughout the halls, and the one that was in the lobby, that was plugged in was empty. The refridgerator in the room was not plugged in either until we did it, by the time it got cold, it was time for us to leave. My best friend whom stayed in the room with us, had to scrub the bathtub before putting the kids in it, it was so nasty!!!! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone EVER!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best "cheap" hotel in Orlando area!”
Reviews.Author: RoughWaterMarine
Reviews.Content: Cheap and clean. No roaches (and we had 6 rooms!) Pool was warm (uncommon for this type hotel) Hot tub was James Brown HOT!! A+ Pool & hot tub maintained every day. A+ Maid service was muy bueno y todas dias. 5 minutes and 3 turns to Disney. It ain't a Crown Plaza but for $27a night, who can pass this up? No free breakfast ($6) and of course owned by Mr Patel but $27!!! Oh! They more than doubled the $2.50/ night "resort" fee because we booked with a third party. F- $154 for 5 nights, total!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: rosetta66
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past but I must say that it has gone down hill. The people who manage the place have let it slip up. The entire hotel is dirty and needs updating. I stayed in the crayola room. The trundle bed was falling apart and there was all sorts of garbage under the bed. The mattress was stained and the sheets were dirty. I was so disgusted but it was to late to get another place. I went to the lobby to ask for an extra pillow and there were people complaining that there was mold in the fridge in their room. The location is great and the staff is friendly but it is just nasty and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jimmybma
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many, many times. We travel with a dog, and they are very accomadating for her, (there is a 10$ a day fee for her, which is normal at most hotels). The pet rooms are at the back of the hotel, which is the section they seem to use most, we have stayed here in June,, July and January time periods and have always found the rooms clean, beds are all newly replaced Serta Pillow tops, new fridges and microwaves. TV has Direct TV Service, which offers about 20 channels, perfectly enough to get thru any length of vacation here. The pool area and hot tub are always spotless! Our only complaint about the pool is that it closes at 11 and after a long day at disney, you want to soak in the tub till the early hours to relax. Any issues we had were taken care of very quickly, The WIFI is great, offers speeds high enough to watch streaming video and upload pics and videos to facebook easily. Despite what other people have writen if you are traveling with a dog here, they will service your room, BUT you need to be there to remove your dog at the time or have your dog in a crate. This only is for their protection and the protection of your dog. I would recommend this hotel to people traveling down there at anytime.. The location is great, its surrounded by a time share resort (not low income housing as was posted in another review), you can be on Disney Property in under 5 minutes. Try it.. for the price you will be pleasantly surprised...

Reviews.Title: “A VERY SAD PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Acer93
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking a room I asked to see what the room looked like. The room they showed me was good for the price. When I went to check in the room they gave me it was terrible. Smelled of smoke. AC filters had mold on it and smelled rotten. I had to clean the filter myself, but the ac still smelled. Sink was dirty I had to scub it with a sos pad. Bathroom was even worse. Toilet and tub was old and dingy. Floor was greasy. Traffic outside the room at all hours of the night. All in all this is one of the worst hotels ever. Good luck and you judge for yourself!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping could be better”
Reviews.Author: sabor69
Reviews.Content: The complaints I have are due to housekeeping. There were spider webs in the window and on top of the curtains and in between the Ac unit which is the only reason why I didn't sleep well because i'm afraid of bugs :). There was also mildew on the caulk outside the corne of the shower. But other than that the service and the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: Bruisergirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 years ago for a week and was very happy. Not this time. Again we booked for a week. We didn't expect a deluxe stay, but the housekeeping was terrible. We came back from a day in the park to find no toilet paper. My husband had to walk to the front desk to get some, since there was no one to bring it to us. Another day, housekeeping never even came to our room so off my husband went again to get some fresh towels. In the morning, walking to breakfast, there was overflowing garbag cans all over the place. We paid in advance for the breakfast which we quickly cancelled after the first morning. If was terrible and dirty in the dining room. Poptarts in the room looked better.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jenn0877
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an affordable place to stay but don't expect anything special then this is your place. Just your basic room. Our room's a/c didn't work but we didn't report it either so that's our fault. All I wanted was a place to sleep after a long day at Disney so this room was fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Guess I learned I got what i payed for”
Reviews.Author: johnhamont
Reviews.Content: Taking my family on a trip with Disney World in mind decided to cheap out on the room and have extra spending money for DisneyWorld after all it was only meant as a place to sleep right??? Well this hotel from the moment I arrived at the front door on my room I knew it would be a bad week. The lock on the door appeared to have been previously broken into the metal cover plate covering it was pryed back (investigating furthur found quite a few other room doors that had this) The room itself looked somewhat clean when we walked in. Small but I expected that. On the plus side the microwave and fridge appeared brand new which doing some grocery shopping at wal-mart superstores for some food in which we made our own quick lunches and breakfasts saved us a few bucks. But back to the room the toilet was like a amusement ride in itself reminded me of a teeter totter when u sat on it. The bath shower area had lost of mildew and the shower head was so rusted I think I saw it in a scrap yard a few weeks ago. The beds had the basic paper thin sheets on up and were very uncofomfortable I didnt have a single good night sleep..... or maybe cause it was the constant sirens from police cars and firetrucks going by considering you basically are on a highway. The general area itself didnt appear to recieve much cleaning either. When I arrived I saw a mixed drink glass sitting on the floor a few doors down from us with a number of beer caps around it. Guess what yup a week later they were all still there. The pictures are terribly misleading probably taken when hotel was brand new. A fellow inmate I was talking to in the hot tub mentioned if I saw the so called game room I hadn't yet so I took a walk over. It was pathetic 3 video games 1 pinball machine and 1 stuffed toy machine of those only 1 video game the pinball machine and stuffed toy machine were the only ones working and I think I played the same games in the 80's. The only complaint I didnt have was the pool area. The pool was clean everyday not terribly warm but kids enjoyed it. Hot tub was extremly hot but after walking all day at Disney beggers couldnt be choosers when you needed to unwind. In summary 1 night stay wouldnt be a bad idea but for a week with a family spend a few extra hundred and get something better.

Reviews.Title: “keep searching ,dont ruin your trip”
Reviews.Author: disneyhaven
Reviews.Content: this hotel shows the pictures of the perfect vacation until you arrive. It looks nothing like the pictures it is owned by people whom do not speak english .The hotel is near some sort of projects or low income housing complex and I was afraid to even leave my car parked there at night .The hotel is so dirty and run down I wanted to leave early it ruined our vacation to the point that we wanted to pay to get another hotel without a refund. sheets and bedding all stained and ripped, bathroom was so dirty there was mold stains all up the walls and on the floors i did not want to even shower in it ,we only stayed for the bunk beds which were so filthy I didnt even want my children to sleep in them. I will only book hotels with great reviews from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Enchanted about this place”
Reviews.Author: mookie1993
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel. It was not so bad that I left, but I would not recommend it nor would I return. I immediately bought a can of Lysol and Lysoled EVERYTHING. My refrigerator did not work, but an old lady and an old man came in a replaced it fairly qickly. And since I had to pay the $2.50 mandatory resort fee, I decided to use mysafe which did not work either. They came and fixed that right away too. The lobby is rather dank. They have SLIPCOVERS on 2 sofas- again- makes you feel like you need Lysol. They should invest in beautifying their lobby for sure. I did not even try the breakfast, the lobby just looked discusting, so I knew i would not eat there. If you ar eon a budget, I guess it would be ok to stay here... It came free to me with my airfare. On the plus side, it had free internet! I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Not so enchanted !!!”
Reviews.Author: BobboV
Reviews.Content: My family and myself sayed at the Enchanted Hojo for 3 nights with our dog Molly along also as the hotel is pet friendly . Unfortunately pet friendly means they won't provide maid service during your stay if you have a dog , As they may accidentaly let it run away ! So my first gripe is that we had no maid service our entire stay ! Next gripe is that the pictures of the hotel on the web are of it when it was brand new , It is now in a very sad state of condition , Our room door looked as if it had been the victim of a break in attempt and was very dented near the handle ! There was garbage around the property ! We had to kill a cockaraoch on the wall late at night ! The TV remote didn't work and had to be replaced ! The refrigerator in the room froze our food solid by the next day ! As if these problems weren't enough , When i appraoched the Manager about these things he seemed very indifferent and annoyed to be dealing with me ! Stay away from this hotel !!! Your $70 a night is much better spent someplace else near Disney !!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible value”
Reviews.Author: KLHenderson
Reviews.Content: I paid $99 a night for a poolside room. There was no seal on the door so we heard everything that was going on in the pool area. The WIFI they offered worked in my room for a whole 10 minutes, I had to go to the lobby to get a connection, there were children running around with no supervision, the room had no been updated in years, I cut my foot on the transition from the tub to the carpet. There was a hot tube in the corner of the room instead of a couch. The game room was gross, the outdoor sitting area was also not the cleanest place. I will never stay at another Howard Johnson again.

Reviews.Title: “Great,just right for our needs”
Reviews.Author: l0vesdisney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, people were friendly that work there, and location is great for Disney. We were also right near a Publix and went every morning to get supplies for the day.We were next door to a pizza place, anround the corner from Taco Bell. Bathroom was clean. No mold. Pool looked nice.Very quiet. No complaints about anything . And the price ! 25.00 a night plus tax. Can't beat that.We have gone to Disney a lot, and always stayed in Kissimmee. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price--Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: alliebear7
Reviews.Content: I must say I was worried of what the hotel could be with having such a low price. So I considered it for awhile....Then I got on here and spent a LONG time reading reviews and was really considering not staying here. But I thought I would go for it! And boy am I glad I did!!!! What a great price approximately $30 a night! Clean room, nice clean pool, room was cleaned daily! My husband and I and 2 children ages 2&3 stayed here 4 nights! We felt very safe here! Location was wonderful! Lots of nice restaurants near by!!! Only maybe 15 min from downtown disney! Check-in and Check-out was very fast and easy! When I come back to FL I will deffinetely stay here again! Thanks for a affordable room and great stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: ericnolan
Reviews.Content: Internet down almost the entire time. keys always had problems. resturants not open anymore. 2.50 resort fee to pay for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel At All Cost”
Reviews.Author: masterall
Reviews.Content: Due to improper check in procedures and lack of concern, the owner, Sanjay Patel, gave unauthorized access to our rooms resulting in a burglary of a laptop and carrying case. According to Florida's Innkeeper Laws, we are to expect comfort and safety when we check in to a hotel. Neither were provided by the owner. All attempts to settle this case has gone unanswered. He refuses to answer my calls, return my messages, or contact me by email or regular mail. He continues to act with impunity toward the law and toward his customers. In today's economy, there are more hotels to choose which appreciate their customers. Save your money and your belongings, AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COST. Otherwise you will end up paying for more than just the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...stay away...stay away”
Reviews.Author: thebebita
Reviews.Content: This place needs serious TLC. The room's plumbing was awful. The sink would back up and so would the tub. The AC took forever to cool the room down. We were supposed to stay for two nights, but only stayed for one as my daughter was ill. However, when I tried calling the hotel to advise my family about the condition of my daughter no one even bothered to answer the telephone in the evening at the hotel front desk! I thought I was getting a good deal for the price, but you couldn't PAY me to return to this place. ...Very dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, with real good AC”
Reviews.Author: kirk20
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week, and the room was good. The AC worked real well, and the beds where comfortable. For the price you cann't beat it for a quick rest stop from the parks. The hot tub and pool where good too. The bad things was the breakfest you had to pay for, and room service was not all that good.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: ykfuller007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in crayola room for 1 week. The room itself is okay the kids room is seperated by half of a wall with a chalkboard. Tv on both sides with a vcr on kids side(free movie rentals at front desk). besides the bathrrom the room was fairly clean and the housekeeper seemed to get a little rude when we asked her to clean bathroom. Everyone at the front desk was very nice and patient with my kids. pool is just okay. The breakfast buffet is not too good of a deal each drink is $2 dollars and the dinner menu consists of indian food. It is in walking distance to many restaurants though.if your looking for somewhere cheap to sleep at night and do a little swimming this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “If you like Bed Bugs, filthy bathroom (long black hair in tub)...then stay.”
Reviews.Author: HateDirt
Reviews.Content: RUN! After a very long drive, we checked into...what we thought....was a well-known name and reputable hotel. NOT! First thing, found a half dead bed bug on the headboard of the bed. Should have turned around then and demanded a refund. Room was dirty, bathroom tub had long black hair stuck to the bath mat.....carpet dirty.....and so on and so forth! Area surrounding place was dirty.....Don't let the front lobby appearance FOOL YOU! When you get to your room-you're in for a surprise - that is - if you are a clean person. Diryh place - We will never stay at ANY HOJO's again!

Reviews.Title: “OH MY GOD!! RUN!! this is one hotel you DON"T want to stay at!!!”
Reviews.Author: smdminnie
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin. Our first clue should have been, when we walked in, the guy behind the desk was combing his hair while waiting on customers. They put us all the way in the back of the hotel, even though we asked to be near the pool. When asked to be switched they told us NO. Our AC didn't work, neither did out Fridge. When we woke up the next day, My mother in the next room found VOMIT..yes VOMIT alll over her curtains. When I called the front desk to have the Manager come out and look at what they put us in, I was told she was too busy. So we took the curtain down our selves and brought it up to her. The Man behind the counter did nothing!! He didn't even appoligize. NOTHING! Staff was VERY rude. I would sleep in my car before going back to a Howard Johnsons. VERY BAD customer Service. Our room looked NOTHING like online. and they didn't have any of the ammenities they said they had. Not cool!! No free ice cream for the kids, no Tiki bar, No restaurant, no nothing! We did contact the board of health and are still waiting to hear back from them!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel; needs fixing, sure...but so does my house!”
Reviews.Author: TrinityHunter
Reviews.Content: I would say this hotel has been bought by the Indian family that owns the restaraunt across the street. My sister and I stayed for 8 nights and had a good time. We headed the warning not to do the breakfast. And don't do breakfast at the nearest IHOP. DIRTY! But the IHOP a little further west down the strip was great! Yes the hotel is old! If you live in a house built before 1960 or paid less than $250,000 this hotel will not bother you at all. No bugs, which I can't say for my own home built in 1928. Newer carpet. Light fixtures needed time to warm before coming on. Shower head was low even for me at 5'3". Our electronic lock died and had to be replaced. Temp dropped one night where we tried to turn the heat on and it STUNK from not having been used. But the pool was fine. We used it twice. The place was not too crowded. Was dissapointed that the bar doesn't open until June. It was quiet in our room. The room was cleaned every day. The staff was polite. Bed was extra firm and we both had a tough time with that first few days. The room was very small but spent very little time there so we were fine. I would stay there again, but we bought into a time share. I've stayed in old Raddison's that had some of the same problems. Not good for people trying to do Disney. Just as I wouldn't say my house is a 5 star, more like a 3 because it's old and needs fixing, I would say the same for this hotel. I felt comfortable there as did my sister.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly nice !!”
Reviews.Author: jen2697
Reviews.Content: First DO NOT ORDER FROM ROMANOS PIZZA- Ripoff and horrible!! Ok so, after reading the reviews I was going to cancel -glad I didn't! We went (me &husband, 12, 5 and infant) We stayed for one week. Great rooms, Awesome pool! Clean. I did not see any bugs in the rooms. The maids cleaned our room everyday. Staff was great. Close to the parks. Very quiet. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place 2 stay”
Reviews.Author: puddaman
Reviews.Content: hotel was ok but didnt like when we checked in resort fee of 2.50 per room they take 30 dollars off your credit card incase u have extra charges say their going to put it back in 3-5 days when u check other than checking in hotel is a nice place 2 stay with kids

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, a definite bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Panteranegra07
Reviews.Content: My family and I (3 kids, wife and I) stayed here from 2/27- 3/8. Just like many others, I was apprehensive about my reservation based on what I had read. However, when we got there it was a pleasant experience. Free internet service was excellent, the rooms were clean, it is not too far from Disney World and it offered all it says it would. However, the breakfast was not all its cracked up to be. By the time we got to the restarant which was around 9 am, everything was cold and hard. There are other places where you can get better breakfast nearby, Ponderosa, Golden Corral, etc... Some of the fixtures in the room and restroom were loose. Also, do not spend the extra money on the Crayola room. My wife saw a picture of it when she was checking us out and its just a crayola divider with a daybed in the middle. Not sure about the tree house rooms though. The exercise room is a small room with a few equipments in it. Never used the pool but it did look clean. Overall, it served its purpose. Especially at $32.50/per night which is what we got it for. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It seemed a pretty safe neighborhood. Not too far from any of the parks and so I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A no frills but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: onemore2go1
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable.Was diappointed that the restarant wasnt open for dinner and the bar was also closed so in the evening we had to walk to one of the near by restarants for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it's made out to be”
Reviews.Author: lisa4761
Reviews.Content: I must say I was apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the reviews but we stayed here for 7 days and had a great time. It's definitely a no frills hotel but we were only interested in having a place to sleep and shower since we spent most days at the amusement parks. The bad things:the color on the tv would come and go and there are only about 20 channels half of them being either sports or spanish speaking, we had a problem with the door to our room not shutting tight but as long as you double checked it was fine, and although I didn't eat there my friends said the breakfast was not worth it especially since there are tons of restaurants nearby. The good things: They have a really nice pool and hot tub. We had it to ourselves almost every night probably because it was an off time for travel but it was nice. They have free high speed internet which does work in the rooms not just the lobby as someone else said in a previous review. They have a refrigerator and microwave both of which came in handy. I thought the room was a decent size and the beds were fairly comfortable. The maids did a very good job keeping the room clean. It's conveniently located near a variety of restaurants and shopping. Overall I liked the place and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: cruzanqn
Reviews.Content: I thought with a well known name like Howard Johnson, I would get a bit more quality and good accomodations. I almost cried when I entered the room. Yes, I was being cheap and felt I could save a few bucks to spend on other things in the parks. Where do I start: the towels were thin and small, one washcloth had holes in it, the stopper in the tub we had to take out because it wouldnt stay up for the water to drain out, I found blond hair under my son's arm when I was washing him up, the toilet paper was the thinnest, cheapest paper I've ever used, pillows were thin, room was dank and dark, the air unit was loud and made a whooshing noise the entire time we were there. Rooms were tight and need SO much updating. Could have left but didn't want to spend our vacation looking for other hotels. Positives: close to parks and shops, staff was friendly, rooms were made up everyday. Eat out! restaurants very close by. Breakfast cost 6 dollars each day not including juice which is 2 dollars. Wish I took pictures so the REAL rooms can be seen instead of the ones from the site. Will spend more money next time.

Reviews.Title: “A place to lay your head - THAT'S ALL”
Reviews.Author: meekomouse
Reviews.Content: I booked our package vacation thru LAST MINUTE TRAVEL. We arrived at our hotel very early(10 am). There are a few HOWARD JOHNSONS on 192 - make sure you are at the correct one. The outside of the hotel looked okay, its NO FOUR STAR - I'm not to sure about the India restaurant that was inside the hotel. It had diarrhea written all over it. We never set foot in the restaurant - I'm not sure if any other guest did too. I asked the front desk clerk if we could check in early if there were rooms available. Unfortunately, there were no rooms available and check in was not until 4 pm. The front desk clerk suggested to check back around 12:30 pm and there may be rooms available. We explored our surroundings and then came back around 1:30 pm. BUT still no rooms were available. The front desk clerk suggested while we waited, he can give us towels to hang out by the POOL. Of course we didn't pass up the chance to go swimming on a hot day. By the time we got our bathsuits and floaters out of the car, the front desk clerk said he has a room available for us. We checked in around 2:30 pm. We were given a room on the first level, towards the back of the building. VERY LIMITED PARKING AND NOT MUCH OF A VIEW. There were no working vending machines or ice machines in our area. The only working machines were near the pool & bar area. The pool & hot tub was a descent size. The bar had happy hour from 1-7 pm with a handful of appetizers. Our room consist of the standard furniture & bedding with a few extras; iron w/ironing board, frig and microwave. The bathroom was small and needed upgrades. First, the bathtub was stained - it needed a good scrubbing and a splash of bleach. Second, the bottom of the door was swollen - when trying to close the door, it would stick and leave pieces of the pressed wood behind. Third, the walls could use a brand new coat of white paint - the walls had black markings and faded paint. Fourth, I'm not sure if house keeping vaccumed the floors - that was well needed. House keeping did a great job cleaning the room & bathroom, taking out the trash and making the beds. I'll give them credit for that. Overall, our family trip was okay - we had a place to lay our heads and take a shower. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. The room was not bad but it was not the best either.

Reviews.Title: “Howard Johnson Enchanted Land Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreyBeardLoone
Reviews.Content: A nice big room for the price we paid for it. A comfortable room, although hotel based on a motel. Reception very basic. Do not take breakfast at the hotel - cheaper in local restaurants. Overall OK for an overnight stay. We would recommend nothing more than a 1 night stay, as there are better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: jenjoey001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on June 2008 for 7 nights, Had a bad experience with the front desk staff very rude, towels were dirty, my son was sleeping on the floor, what was suppose to be treehouse bunk beds, the bottom bed was in the floor with a 2x4 wood holding the mattress. My toilet was stop up and they bring me the plunger for me to unclog it. walls were dirty, dresser draws were broken, lamps look like a disaster. nothing like the pictures in the internet. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone especially if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect”
Reviews.Author: clmick71
Reviews.Content: Hard to find, many HOJO's on the same street. Pool & rooms do not look like the photo's listed. Got into area 3 hours early, would NOT let us check in early. Said no rooms were cleaned. When we finally got a room, there were webs all across front door, (so it hadn't been cleaned with in a few hours.) Changed the reservation the day before from 4 nights to 1 due to a change in plans, been 3 weeks and still haven't seen a credit to our charge card. They do charge you a $ 2.50 for a resort fee, what ever the heck that is. I asked at the front desk, they couldn't explain it. They stated everyone gets that fee. If your going to be staying all day in your hotel, this is not the place for you. If your just going to be sleeping, then you may be ok. The staff at the front desk has a problem speaking and understanding English. So beware when trying to communicate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Kimsy151
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed just one night on our weekend trip to Orlando. I booked online through Wyndham Rewards and used my AAA discount and only paid $38 after taxes and resort fees. The front desk staff was very friendly. The bartender at the tiki bar was great too. The room was definitely worth the money. It had a double bed w/ a TV and then a wall separated that from a pull out sofa and another TV. My only complaint about the room was that the bathroom floor was dirty - hair and dirt - and the carpet looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in a while. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub despite the overload of children at 9pm. We had cocktails at the little tiki bar that was poolside. Didn't use the game room or exercise room. The exercise room was just an old guest room with 3 machines in it. For the money, it was a great value. I will definitely consider it the next time I come to Orlando/Kissimmee. If you plan on staying IN your hotel room or on hotel property for a lot of your stay, I would pay a little more to stay somewhere a little cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “nice pool”
Reviews.Author: sallybristol001
Reviews.Content: Arrived here frustrated after a long drive from Florida keys & unable to find a booked Best Western (it had changed names) the Howard Johnson was a typical Kissimmee motel type place, outside balconies, room was clean, tried the breakfast in the adjoining 'restaurant' had mouldy jam & sparse meal by Orlando standards. Loved the Golden Corral, buffet meals with steak being grilled at dinner & the breakfast was good..yes steak then too was on offer!! plenty of choice & so cheap. This was a return trip, last time was 20yrs ago and was disappointed how 'run down' the area had got, but once again, it was cheap, ideal for a few days stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy”
Reviews.Author: Caco2005
Reviews.Content: Although the price is low, when you arrive at a hotel you expect a clean place. The chairs wese black from people's hands and dust all over the place The walls were dirty. False advertisement on park tickets. The prices they offer are conditioned to participate in a Timeshare presentation. Had to pay for breakfast. Do not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Waste Your Money!”
Reviews.Author: msairways
Reviews.Content: Staying at Howard Johnson Enchanted Land was 92% complete disaster! During the first night that my boyfriend and I stayed, I took a shower and while I was lathering the washcloth, I noticed a hole in the middle of the cloth, and it kept getting bigger. The towels had stains on them, the toilet paper rolls were half used, and the staff stuttered through their responses every time I asked a question as if they werent sure if they were even working their, and few of them spoke clear english. The last two days of our stay, I went to take a shower and a ROACH was crawling on the bathroom counter. I went nextdoor to my cousins room and right after I told her what happened, she saw an army of ants on her bathroom floor. We immediately went to the front desk and demanded another room with a complete inspection and no roaches. They tried to charge US for their pest problem and even asked what we wanted them to do about the creepy crawlers that were in our room....Long story short, I was purely disgusted, and it was a complete inconvenience to have bugs in my room and to have to move to a new room at 2am. Beware, because I dont ever intend to patronize them again.

Reviews.Title: “My Kids Loved The Howard Johnson Enchanted Land”
Reviews.Author: georgiasmilie
Reviews.Content: I did stay last weekend in this affordable and nice hotel. Me and my family had a very good time there. I will recomend it to all my friends and family. nice rooms, nice staff, nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: shutterbug1980
Reviews.Content: I was reasonably impressed with this Howard Johnson at the end of our stay. I was alarmed by the negative reviews on this site and almost decided to book elsewhere, but we didn't encounter any of the problems that other travellers had. We arrived in Orlando three hours ahead of schedule, and the management let us check in early with no questions asked. We were told that the only rooms available so early were on the back of the building, which concerned me at first, but found our room to be quiet, since we were farther from the pool. There was one dead bug when we entered, but we didn't see any others for the duration of our stay. I would hope that the next time we travel, we'll have more funds to spend on lodging, but if we don't, I would be willing to try this Howard Johnson again. My son really enjoyed the pool area, and since we didn't know about the free ice cream, it was a pleasant surprise for him.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Bugs, Terrible, Stay Away.”
Reviews.Author: CheshireRexxie
Reviews.Content: When check-in I informed reception of having 2 small children but was informed Was on second floor, told no lifts which was difficult for me as my 9 month old and 6 year old was asleep in car with husband waiting with them. Struggled upstairs as it was late with children and luggage., but room smelt and carpet was disgusting so reception offered another room. Next room has cracks in bath and sink, missing plaster off walls and ceilings, squashed insects on walls, marked linen both bath and bed linen, Couldn't unpack because drawers fell apart in hand, as it was late we left speaking to reception till morning, but in morning I went to wash baby bottles but noticed insects around sink, informed reception who arranged kitchen to wash bottles, only to be handed back with parts missing, so we had to buy new bottles and formula milk. Went out for the day but when returned opened fridge to a load of cockroaches running around, as it was late there were no managers around, reception agreed to move us again as we couldn't get hold of emergency number to inform travel company as number was constantly engaged. carrying my baby and 6 year old undressed with luggage at 3a.m is unacceptable. moved hotel to much better standard the next day but a lot more expensive hotel, complaint ongoing at present.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: mommytorw
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay. The price was right, and the beds were comfortable. We never saw a bug the whole time we were there. Having a TV for ourselves and one for the kids was great. The poolside bar prices were no different than would be expected for the convience. The pool was a little overcrowed, but hey, everyone wanted to swim on a nice sunny afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Howard Johnsons Enchanted Land”
Reviews.Author: Flowerchild1968
Reviews.Content: Newly named the "HO-JO's from Hell" Do NOT Stay there! The rooms are dirty. The toilets stop up easily. The rooms are dirty! Every day we had problems getting into our room because our keys quit working and one night got locked out completely and they had trouble getting in with their master key. The "tree-house" beds for the kids are a joke. We found a pair of prescription reading glasses and toys that it is not telling how long they had been there. The little cubby-hole area was dirty. Their nightly "ice-cream party" for the kids consisted of those little cups of ice cream set out on a table in a pan if ice. The wireless Internet does not work in the rooms...you have to basically stay in the lobby or pool area for it to work. The "complimentary shuttle" runs twice a day--early morning to parks and late night retun to hotel. So, we ended up driving back and forth to parks and having to pay for parking each day. We complained daily about the room being dirty, but it did no good. Don't stay there1

Reviews.Title: “So much Potential.. What a Shame!”
Reviews.Author: SolisBusiness
Reviews.Content: We were driving down Irlo Bronson looking for a Place to stay and thinking that since we had our two Daughters with us 3 yr and 12 yr. Saw the Sign Tree house rooms got curious rented a room of course my 3 yr. got very excited and went to the "Tree House Bunk Bed" and Bugs started crawling all over. I'm Lucky I was watching or else My Baby gril was ready to jump from the bed as soon as she saw the Bugs. We went to the front desk, It was Late, we were tired, we got another room checked out the next morning and not even a Sorry was expressed. It is Ashame, It is a Greta concept and has to be Kept Clean specially for Children.

Reviews.Title: “Boy, has this place gone downhill.”
Reviews.Author: antq
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the claims promised on their website (or the night-lit photo), because this motel isn't what it used to be. Our room smelled of cat urine, and 30 minutes after moving in the air conditioner quit. The spa wasn't hot, the pool ladder was broken, we had ants around our bathroom sink, the ice machine was broken, and their wifi kept kicking us offline. Our bed box springs shook like jello when we sat down, the Disney shuttle came 15 minutes earlier than scheduled, the restaurant now serves Indian food (no surprise there), and breakfast is $6.99 a person. There is no longer "free evening ice cream for the kids" as advertised, they charge a $2 "convenience fee", and a man who'd been there for two weeks told me his sheets had yet to be changed (four days was long enough for me). To top it all off, our vanity (the one with ants) sported a sign reading, “All linen is inventoried upon check-out. An appropriate charge will be made for missing items.” Talk about guest-friendly... Kissimmee has DOZENS of motels, many American-owned. Do yourself a favor and pick another one. ANY other one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible..Never will stay again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TnTraveler2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a horrible experience!!!! First thing is when you check in they give you a form to sign to charge you $2.14 a day to make sure your stuff in the room safe stays safe and for local calls. You can decline this charge but it made me feel like since I wouldn't pay extra surprise fee that my stuff would not be there when I returned. If you like Tacos you will like the beds because thats how you feel sleeping in them. The mattress wrapped up around you. The even sank with just a small suitcase on top. My fiance was afraid to sleep in shorts and a t-shirt and slept in a sweat shirt and jeans just not to touch the sheets. The bathroom had the same two pieces of hair on the floor the whole time we were there. Just above the bathtub there were two holes in the wall. Around the shower head was a horrible plaster job and the walls were painted with different color paint. The bathroom was so small that I don't even think it would take a full can of paint or more than 30mins to an hour to fix the bathroom up. Above the sink on the ceiling there were cobwebs. Oh! Let’s not forget the telephone jack being completely out of the wall and the free internet should be more like What Internet! The wireless didn't work. Also the power outlet was loose because if you moved the wire the power going to the laptop would go off. I mentioned these problems to the manager on duty during check out and he offered to mail us a deep discount to stay there again. That will not happen!!! I didn't eat there or use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: ReeciePeicie
Reviews.Content: Howard Johnson gave us much more than we expected for our money... We booked through Expedia, with a rate of $30 a night and did not expect much. Our room had 2 double beds, a microwave and a fridge. It also had cable and HBO. The room was a decent size and fairly clean (however we did see an ant on the bed upon check-in).... The A.C. worked well and we were provided with shampoo, soap and conditioner. Parking was free. Seemed like it was a Safe Place, didnt have any problems. Tons of Food close by. We do realize that September is an off-peak month for Disney, so we did not have any neighbors, hence cannot comment on noise level through walls. It is VERY close to Disney.... In fact I think we make have spent more time drive around the entire Disney Complex (going from hotel to hotel and park to park (just checking it out)) than we did from our hotel to the Parks. You literally Hop on 3 roads (4 if you count the road HJ is on) to get to Disney.... was very happy about that. We also went to Universal Studios........ This was a bit further, but not much and just as easy to get to- Just jumped on highway and couldnt miss the huge signs. Is this the nicest hotel you will ever stay in? NO Is it comfortable and convenient? I say yes. I can however see were people who booked the special "tree house" or "crayola" rooms may be disappointed.... I looked in some open windows and they looked pretty cheesy/small compared to pictures online. I am not sure how much they are, but if they are more than 15- 20 bucks a night more Id say skip it! The pool was very warm and stayed open till 11. I would suggest stopping at a grocery store and getting drinks and snacks to keep in the room since the vending machine charges $1.00 per can of soda and $1.00 per bag of chips.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kadiri
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from 08/13/07 through 08/17/07 with my family for my disney trip to Florida. The rooms are smelly and the corpets are old and dirty. On top of that there are bed bugs and spiders in the room. Please dont stay in this hotel it is really not worth the money. I reserved this hotel through hotelcorps.com and i called them to shift me from this place but they said it will cost me so much money so i decided to stay here only for sleeping by closing my eyes, nose.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: Elhombreviejo
Reviews.Content: Imagine going into the bathroom of your room, you go to close the door, and all of the sudden the entire door, frame and all, comes off its hinges. That's what happened to my girlfriend and me during a recent stay at this Howard Johnson motel. To its credit, the motel had a maintenance worker nail the frame back in place, but unfortunately, the bathroom door-lock was left messed up, so that if you happened to close the door while inside the bathroom, there was no way to escape -- without help from someone on the otherside. To its credit, the hotel had another maintenance worker fix this -- at 10 p.m. at night. Unfortunately, between the two maintenance people, they messed up the locking mechanism in the main door into the room, and that had to be reprogrammed. You get the picture. This is an older motel that has out-moded, small rooms with small beds, and some of the beds are actually roll-out of couches. On top of all this, the air-conditioning in our room didn't blow cold, so we spent a couple of hot nights. For this kind of accommodation, the hotel charges way too much. The best thing about it is its location; it's an easy hop to Disney World and there's a good Bob Evans restaurant within walking distance. Give the hotel management a little credit, too, for taking the time to mail back (COD) some items we left behind. But, unless you're a college student who doesn't care where you stay, this place isn't recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: 01_disney_fanatic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HJ enchanted land on Memorial day weekend, (2007). We booked the hotel on lastminutetravel.com. We paid $31 + $5 resort fee per night (stayed for 3 nights). We were surprised how nice it was for the money we paid. (Though, it's an old hotel & not in the best part of town). Our room was completely renovated, everything was obviously brand new [new carpet (the old carpet was still in the hallways), bed linens, tile in the bathroom, rounded shower curtain rod]. Pictures of hotel on website were pretty accurate... everything looked as it does on the website. My children loved the pool. My husband & I loved the pool bar. The staff was great. The restuarant was ok. Great hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: scorder
Reviews.Content: Me and my family just got back from a week in Florida, we stayed our first 2 nights at this hotel and were pretty satisfied since it was pretty cheap. I do have to warn people that the buffet is not what it is made out to be, we would not send our dogs or our worse enemy to eat there!!! They were all out of eggs and didn't bother bringing more out, the sausage was cold, they had gravy and no biscuits, no bacon, 2 pancakes that looked like they had been there a while. The only thing me and my husband ate were some potato wedge things and toast, and my kids had cereal because I wouldn't let them eat anything else...The next morning we ate at IHOP down the street, much better!! Otherwise the staff was fine, room was clean, only complaints are the buffet and the beds were not the most comfortable of course!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: glittermk
Reviews.Content: photo's of jaccuquizze room are misleading not as nice as pic on website. there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom. I fell on wet walkway with no wet water sign I told office they offered to call paramedics but I said I didn't need it at the time. and never chec ked on me on my fall after that. asked for a pillow in the lobby and they gave me a dirty pillow with candy smeared on it! I did call and complain when I returned home from my trip and I received a complimentary free two days one night voucher to use in the future.

Reviews.Title: “not excellent at all”
Reviews.Author: edward5479
Reviews.Content: I went there with my family, May 18-25 2007 and it was not at all like the pictures are. The rooms had problems with the dressers the key didn't work right and in one of the rooms we found bugs. the service and people where nice but the hotel needs lots of work to be done to it. the pool had bugs in it all the time and if you like indian food that is what they serve. not for anything with indian food but not with all the spiceness and the smell of those spices. they need to paint it up and it felt like it was one of the cheap motels here in new jersey. i would not stay there again, not going to be cheap about where to stay. i rather dish out the extra mony and get a good hotel then stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: funnyface1
Reviews.Content: I do NOT recommend this hotel. My son and I stayed there and it was nothing like the picture. The room needed a lot of work, such a paint and new carpet. There were dark smudges all over the place and there were huge bleached out spots on the carpet. The only positive thing I can say about this place is that the room was clean. The beds were terrible and I woke up in pain because the bed was so bad. The worst part was that someone was smoking an illegal substance and the hotel staff did nothing about it when I brought it to their attention; we could smell it again the next morning. There were loud people outside our room for most of the night. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Save your money and go somewhere better!

Reviews.Title: “Not enchanted”
Reviews.Author: KKMILLS
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel March 15-20 2007 and I will not be returning. My family booked the Crayola Room which I must say is a waste of money. The room smelled musty, the beds were not comfortable, and the rooms were not very clean. I asked the housekeeper to clean our bathroom as we left the first day and came back and saw that she had left an envelope saying "I cleaned your bath you can leave tips in here". Also the breakfast buffet is a rip off. It does not include the drinks which are a dollar each even for my kids a cup of apple juice. Also our total came up to 17.98 and my husband gave a hundred dollar bill to the staff she came back and gave him two dollars and when he asked for the rest of his change she got very rude and said "your going to wait for two pennies" she said she didn't realize he gave her a hundred dollar bill. I will NEVER EVER return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: cel70
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you first off that next time we are in Disney, we will not be pinching pennies and will stay in a much better place, preferably a Disney resort. Our stay at this Ho Jo was not the best. The rooms were smelly and dirty. The beds were NOT comfortable at all. It seemed like when my husband and I slept in the full sized bed, we both ended up in a hole in the middle. We were in the tree house room the first night - the treehouse was not too bad - my son enjoyed it. The second and last nites we were there, we stayed in the Crayola room - major waste of money! My boy went to use the easel and the bottom of it fell out. It was broken! Oh, our key card would not work for our room. After the clerk reprogrammed the card three times it still would not work. My husband finally got ticked off and got him to come to our room directly and open it with a key. Turned out the battery in the door lock was dead - it was replaced the next day. The pool was okay but if you go in it at night, do not expect to get a towel. They run out quickly. It was a cheap place, needs major updating. The breakfast buffet is a rip off. My husband asked for orange juice and he got Sunny Delight which has no juice in it whatsoever, plus it did not come in the cost of the crappy buffet. And don't succomb to the wheeler dealer in the lobby trying to get you to visit time shares for discounted disney tickets. Don't waste your time, you are on vacation and you have precious few time to spend on it! Oh, I forgot to mention the big wolf spider that surprised me in the bathroom the day we left. Freaked me out! I asked my husband where it could have possibly come from and he said probably under the front door which had a big gap. What other critters could have come in??? Since I have left I have a boil in my hair line on the back of my neck - I am hoping this was not caused by anything at this hotel like bed bugs. UGH!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTammy
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel room on-line I was looking for the cheapest room rates in the Orlando area without "Terrible" ratings. This property is you typical 1970's motel. It was OK for the $35/night that I paid, but we stayed at the Quality Inn on International Drive for $60/night the following weekend after our cruise and were MUCH happier there.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay”
Reviews.Author: noodlepaul
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid 60.00 US it was not worth the problems. The bed was small, the air conditionar would not cool and the walls were so thin we could hear every noise outside. If you could get this room for a night and pay no more then 40$ then it might be worth it, my family and I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: melody2angel2
Reviews.Content: i was unhappy with the hotel i was staying in, saw a coupon for this one, they let me see one of the rooms. i would recommend it . nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “not all it seems..”
Reviews.Author: anniecm
Reviews.Content: y husband, 2year old and 4 year old stayed here for a week. The main reasons we picked this hotel is because it had shuttle service to parks and 2 bedrm suites. There actually are no 2 room suites at all. Instead, there is a partion with trundle bed between the double bed and bathroom. The rooms are really teeny teeny tiny. They were clean enough but so small it was hard to actually walk in them. the pool was nice. The shuttle only went to 3 parks once daily, pretty late, and picked up once daily....(and they stop at 7 other places)We ended up spending over $400 on taxis (60 a day roundtrip to parks). Be absolutely sure you insist on the correct shuttle schedule before you go there! all in all, we could have stayed at a value resort In The The Park. do Not book through a time share, they are completely dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “DISenchanted with Enchanged Land Resort”
Reviews.Author: Shadohart
Reviews.Content: I booked the "tree house" room because the pictures online were so adorable. The actual room left a LOT to be desired. They told us that the adult bed was queen sized - not. The room was dingy and dirty. They came and c leaned the carpet for us while we were out, but there was so much that they missed. I used one of their towels to clean the handrail (painted yellow - but looked brown before cleaning) that night and ruined the thing. (photo uploaded) The kids loved the loft bed and the tiny TV that was beside the bottom "bunk" (actually just a thin mattress on the floor) so we stayed, but never again. We paid a LOT for that room and should have gotten resort treatment ... it just wasn't there.
