Overall: Cute idea but it falls short - Definately NOT worth the cost for the "kid" room, especially since we spent most of our time in the parks.

Reviews.Title: “not great but good enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival the staff were friendly and helpful even though the reception looks nothing like the photos. Didn't really use any of the facilities at the hotel (why would you) but it has a small ish pool and a hot tub that stays open until 11pm. The rooms were quite basic but had pretty much everything we needed. 2 double beds, safe deposit box, large TV, hairdryer, iron and board, fridge, microwave and tea/coffeee machine. The one thing i would say is there was not enough storage for clothes. The rooms were cleaned every day with fresh towels left out (a bit small). Only saw 2 roaches which was a pleasant change as we normally holiday in the canary islands and they are infested. Overall the hotel is in a good position for Disney with loads of restaurants nearby and lets be honest the room was only for collapsing in at the end of very busy days.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Tues. evening and checked out first thing Wed. We asked for another room because the door would not lock and we did not feel safe. The second room was old and not clean - afraid for my bare feet to touch the carpeting. The bathroom was nasty. There was not 1 ice machine that worked. Too many places to choose from to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Howard Johnson in Kissimee the service was great personnel very friendly & helpful especially Oswaldo & Peter the room was very nice & clean and we had noting at all to complain about. We took a trip to Tampa stayed for 2 nights and came back to this hotel to finished our Disney trip. The free shuttel to the parks were always on time so we had noting to worry about.Thank You for making our disney vacation something to treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Kids Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for my 3 kids, ranging in age from 1 1/2 yrs, 4 yrs, 6 yrs. The Tree House room was great. The kids really enjoyed it. It definetly wasn't the cleanest place I have stayed, but it was a 2.9 in cleanliness from a 1-5 rating. The hotel definetly needs to remodel and put in new carpet. Even though we had a NON SMOKING room, there was a slight smokey odor. Not bad enough to complain to the front about though. The Breakfast Buffet was wonderful. An excellent variety for both adult and kids. My in-laws went with us as well. They got the King Bed room. There's was cleaner than ours, but they even enjoyed the stay and the buffet. We never had time to enjoy the pool, but it was packed every night. I would stay again with the kids, but if it was just my husband and I, we would probably go to a newer or remodeled hotel; for a more adult setting. As you know the Enchanted Land Resort is more of a kid friendly hotel (play room, ice cream social, pool, Tree House room)....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Howard Johnson's Enchanted Land. I stayed for 6 nights and really had no major complaints. Only thing I wished they had was more times coming and going from the theme parks. Universal Studios only had 1 time in the morning to leave (10:30 am) and 1 time at night (7:30 pm) coming back to the hotel. The park closed at 10pm. If you really love theme parks, then you know this was a major disappointment. We had to take taxis back to the hotel everynight and that I must say was the worst part of the whole trip. The cheapest roundtrip I could find to and from Universal Studios was $48. The breakfast buffet was pretty decent for $6 and the rooms, although small were cleaned very well everyday. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay even if it was FREE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a promotion through Special T Travel. Well, believe me........if you think its too good to be true, believe it.........its worse than you thought..... I was really nervous when they finally 'assigned' me to this 'Resort' and read the reviews.....I also thought, well, this is prepaid 'non refundable' and how bad could it be..........WELL, it was really, really bad. NEVER, NEVER again will I plan anything through Special T Travel. They need to send someone to 'look' before they put people into their so call 'premium' lodging. Plans were to stay for 6 nights. Someone has some nerve putting the word 'resort' in the name. It basically is a run down motel that needs to be leveled and rebuilt. I should have known I was in trouble when I was asked to purchase 'Room Safe' insurance. The first room I received was way in the back parking lot with absolutely no security (safe looked like someone tried to unscrew the front panel to break in). Closet was just a coat rack barely hanging off the wall. It was hot, and smelled like a seedy, filthy bar. (which the air conditioner only added to) It was the type of place that you wouldn't want to even walk on the carpet with socks on, let alone barefoot. I do have to say that the gentlemen at the front desk was very friendly, helpful and courteous and asked if I wanted to then 'upgrade' to a Jr Suite after I called and said that the room was unacceptable (my daughter has asthma and cannot be in a room where the previous guests smoked - apparently non-stop). No reflection on him, but it wasn't much better. Pool was very small, and definitely did not have enough chairs for the number of guests staying there. Unless you really believe in that saying, 'you are only sleeping there', considering I don't even know how anyone would even feel safe 'sleeping', I would move on as we did. Luckily, there was an Olive Garden within walking distance. We went and had a great dinner and asked our waitress for some suggestions. She and the manager gave us a few suggestions, and off we went. Our vacation was saved.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Enchanted Land Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 4985 West Irlo Bronson Highway, Kissimmee, FL 34746
